intro: Ageratum altissimum, commonly known as the tall ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring finely divided, aromatic leaves. Its flowers are usually blue, purple, or white, and they bloom in late summer to early autumn. Ageratum altissimum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant color and ability to attract pollinators.
